image.altText: Close-up of man

items.synopsis: Victoria Cross recipient Ben Roberts-Smith directed one of his SAS comrades to kill an elderly man who was dragged from a mosque in Afghanistan, according to allegations examined by the Brereton inquiry into alleged war crimes.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith revealed as soldier accused in Brereton inquiry of directing killing of imam

image.altText: A wide view of the town near a lake.

items.synopsis: Four children, all around three years old, and one adult are injured in a knife attack in the French town of Annecy.

title.children: Knife attacker wounds four young children in French alpine town, critically injuring two

image.altText: Steve Smith throws his head back as the stumps are broken behind him

items.synopsis: Australia all out for 469 as Australia loses 7-142 on day two of the World Test Championship final, as India fight back. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Australia all out after lunch as Smith makes 31st Test century

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Indian flags are flying but it will be Australia who are happiest after that first innings. Australia's 469 is an imposing total, especially given the pitch has really started to dry out, it's not green any more and there are cracks developing as it dries out and the weather continues to turn on a show for us. India will need to bat well in difficult conditions, and Australia are going to get a first look at the Duke ball in the hand of Scott Boland and, I for one, am excited by that. So if you're thinking of going to bed, don't go yet... things might be about to get spicey.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australia all out for 469

children.content: Indian flags are flying but it will be Australia who are happiest after that first innings.

Australia's 469 is an imposing total, especially given the pitch has really started to dry out, it's not green any more and there are cracks developing as it dries out and the weather continues to turn on a show for us.
India will need to bat well in difficult conditions, and Australia are going to get a first look at the Duke ball in the hand of Scott Boland and, I for one, am excited by that.
So if you're thinking of going to bed, don't go yet... things might be about to get spicey.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Caught at extra cover off a slower ball by Rahane!
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: CUMMINS IS OUT!

children.content: Caught at extra cover off a slower ball by Rahane!

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: You miss, I hit, says Siraj, and Lyon misses with the expansive drive with no footwork that remains a specialty of the lower order batters of world cricket, and Siraj castles his off stump. Lyon goes for 9 from 25 and Australia are 9 down. That's Siraj's 50th Test wicket
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: BOWLED HIM! LYON DEPARTS!

children.content: You miss, I hit, says Siraj, and Lyon misses with the expansive drive with no footwork that remains a specialty of the lower order batters of world cricket, and Siraj castles his off stump.
Lyon goes for 9 from 25 and Australia are 9 down.

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka and Alexander Lukashenko.

items.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka is "not an expert in politics" and never has that been more apparent than when she denounced a war and an autocratic strongman with a history of revenge.

title.children: Europe's last dictator celebrated this young tennis star. Then Aryna Sabalenka publicly disowned him

image.altText: A man with long, blonde, curly hair, poses and smiles at a camera, wearing a pattern shirt, standing in front of a window.

items.synopsis: Scott White was arrested in 2020 over Scott Johnson's death, decades after the then-27-year-old's body was found at the base of cliffs in Manly near a gay beat.

title.children: 'Our family has got some peace': Sydney cliff killer jailed decades after death of US mathematician

image.altText: Mark Turner, the MLA for the Palmerston seat of Blain, sits in NT Parliament looking concerned.

items.synopsis: Mr Turner says he was made aware of Territory Labor's decision not to renew his membership at the same time as the media.

title.children: NT politician Mark Turner expelled from Labor Party

image.altText: A Navy officer in camo fatigues uses binoculars to look from the side of his ship towards another boat across choppy grey water

items.synopsis: China says all of the South China Sea belongs to it and presses its claims with a huge deployment of coast guard and fishing boats as far as 1,500km off its coastline, while Indonesia says the planned exercise is about  strengthening "ASEAN centrality".

title.children: ASEAN to hold first joint military exercise off Indonesia as South China Sea tensions simmer

image.altText: A man sitting on a couch with a blue backdrop with the initials CBN.

items.synopsis: Pat Robertson, a religious broadcaster who turned a tiny Virginia TV station into the global Christian Broadcasting Network, ran for president and helped make religion central to Republican Party politics in America, has died at 93.

title.children: US religious broadcaster Pat Robertson dies aged 93

image.altText: A large crowd with people holding shields over some people exiting a car.

items.synopsis: The former Pakistani prime minister says he is facing nearly 150 charges, all of which he denies, since his initial May 9 arrest.

title.children: Imran Khan granted bail on new charges accusing him of link to murder

image.altText: A young woman with red lipstick smiles while hugging her grandmother

items.synopsis: Around one in three families has multiple generations living under the same roof. Cost of living could see that figure increase.

title.children: Young people are moving back in with their families — and it's not just them benefiting

image.altText: Greg Jenkins holds a box with his mother's ashes at Adelaide Airport

items.synopsis: The family of an Adelaide woman who disappeared in Malaysia more than five years ago says the circumstances of her death will now be re-examined in court.

title.children: Family of woman whose remains were found in Malaysia says 'mum's case remains open'

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

items.synopsis: Those onboard a delayed Rex Airlines flight intending to travel from Perth to Monkey Mia were told mid-flight the plane wouldn't be stopping and they would need to find their own way to their destination.

title.children: Rex Airlines skips scheduled stop mid-flight, leaving passengers stranded

image.altText: A A380 passenger plane with British Airways branding.

items.synopsis: The Cl0p ransomware syndicate announces on its dark web site that victims have until June 14 to negotiate a ransom or risk having sensitive stolen data dumped online.

title.children: BBC, British Airways among first big-name victims in global supply-chain hack

image.altText: A tattooed man singing on stage

items.synopsis: Mitchell David Callaway was arrested at a house in Bowraville on Thursday morning after a five-year investigation by task force detectives.

title.children: Former X-Factor contestant Mitchell Callaway charged with alleged 2018 murder of baby girl in Binnaway

image.altText: A view from above of water surrounding houses.

items.synopsis: Ukraine says the average level of flooding in the Kherson region is 5.61 metres as authorities work to evacuate more people after the collapse of the Nova Kakhovka dam.

title.children: About 600 square kilometres of Ukraine's Kherson region reportedly under water after dam destroyed

image.altText: A middle-aged man of Korean descent hands a stack of papers to another man behind a desk in an office building.

items.synopsis: The country's Truth and Reconciliation Commission has previously acknowledged the records of many adoptees sent to the West were manipulated and falsely described them as orphans, increasing their adoptability.

title.children: South Korean inquiry to investigate 237 more foreign adoptions suspected to be fraudulent

image.altText: Cyril Rioli celebrates a Hawthorn goal

items.synopsis: Brisbane Lions coach Chris Fagan backs his relationship with Cyril Rioli, after the former Hawks star identified himself as one of the complainants in the Hawthorn investigation.

title.children: 'We had a great friendship': Fagan says his relationship with former Hawks star was 'positive'

image.altText: Albanese smiles on a cold morning, the autumnal red leaves of the Budget Tree creating a backdrop behind him.

items.synopsis: As economists warn the prospect of keeping the economy on "an even keel" has further diminised, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he is optimistic the economy can ride out inflation.

title.children: Anthony Albanese says he's optimistic about the economy, as interest rates bite and recession warnings grow

image.altText: queensland premier annastacia palaszczuk gestures with both hands while speaking in parliament

items.synopsis: Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk speaks about her own miscarriage after an internal review was ordered into the emergency department care a woman received after losing her child.

title.children: Palaszczuk opens up about 'heartbreaking' miscarriage, commits to care overhaul

image.altText: A light purple hollow circle on a background of lemon yellow.

items.synopsis: Australian-first laws banning unnecessary and irreversible medical procedures for intersex children pass in the ACT Legislative Assembly.

title.children: ACT passes nation-first ban on irreversible surgery for young intersex children

image.altText: The tail of a Jetstar and Qantas plane

items.synopsis: Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce says the new Western Sydney Airport will be the most technologically advanced and efficient in Australia when it opens in late 2026.

title.children: Qantas and Jetstar first airlines to fly domestically from Sydney's new $5.3b airport

image.altText: Jack Higgins flexes his muscles and yells in delight

items.synopsis: St Kilda come out on top of Sydney in a game that fails to raise to any great heights, but sees Lance Franklin become the fourth greatest goalkicker in VFL/AFL history.

title.children: Saints prevail in scrappy clash with Swans as Franklin makes more history

image.altText: Titans players gather around AJ Brimson in celebration

items.synopsis: A potentially serious injury to Api Koroisau rubs salt into the Tigers' wounds as they go down 28-12 against the Titans on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Titans cruise to victory as Tigers' Koroisau suffers broken jaw

image.altText: Before and after images show the flood damage

items.synopsis: Satellite images show the extent of the damage as one of the biggest reservoirs of water in the world drains across war-ravaged Ukraine.

title.children: A flood of biblical proportions: Southern Ukraine will be inundated with 36 Sydney Harbours in days

image.altText: For Sale signage outside a suburban house.

items.synopsis: New research shows more than 25 per cent of homes sold in Queensland, Victoria and NSW were paid for in cash by older Australians who have benefited from high property prices and are "basically immune" to the effects of rising interest rates.

title.children: With another interest rate rise, there's a large group of home buyers 'immune' from its impacts

image.altText: Bird's eye view of rows of newly built houses with green lawns and solar panels on roofs.

items.synopsis: Rental advocates call for mandates requiring landlords to install solar panels on tenants' roofs amid warnings renters are missing out on the benefits of green energy.

title.children: Calls to force landlords to install solar panels on tenants' roofs

image.altText: People standing under a bridge with orange haze around them

items.synopsis: Eerie images of New York City's skyline veiled by a layer of yellowish haze resemble scenes from science fiction film Blade Runner 2049. But why and how is it spreading so far?

title.children: Canadian wildfire smoke has engulfed the US east coast. How did they start and why is it travelling so far?

image.altText: A RAAF F/A-18 taxis on a runway in Katherine.

items.synopsis: Kyiv assures the White House that it would not deploy second-hand Australian warplanes into Russian airspace if dozens of the retired F/A-18s are transferred to Ukraine.

title.children: Retired Australian F/A-18 Hornet jets a step closer to joining Ukraine's war effort

image.altText: Three images of Shannen Doherty having a mask placed over her head and mouth.

items.synopsis: Despite a mastectomy, radiation and chemotherapy, the Beverley Hills  90210 actor says her breast cancer has spread to her brain.

title.children: 'This is what cancer can look like': Shannen Doherty shares candid radiation treatment video

image.altText: Performer in black costume on a stage.

items.synopsis: The latest "blatant agenda to bring hell to earth" in sleepy old Hobart is about to kick off — and, true to form, has timed the pressing of the outrage button to perfection.

title.children: Dark Mofo does it again with outrage summoned on command
